results.title: Pilot Study Assessing Tolerability and Metabolic Effects of Metformin in Patients With Li-Fraumeni Syndrome.
results.text_hl: Pilot Study Assessing Tolerability and Metabolic Effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ in @SPECIES_9606 @@@Patients@@@ With @<m>DISEASE_Li_Fraumeni_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016864 @@@Li-Fraumeni Syndrome@@@.

results.title: Cancer Precision-Prevention trial of Metformin in adults with Li Fraumeni syndrome (MILI) undergoing yearly MRI surveillance: a randomised controlled trial protocol
results.text_hl: Pilot trial: short-term administration of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ to adults with @<m>DISEASE_Li_Fraumeni_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016864 @@@LFS@@@

citations.NLM: Dixon-Zegeye M, Shaw R, Collins L, Perez-Smith K, Ooms A, Qiao M, Pantziarka P, Izatt L, Tischkowitz M, Harrison RE, George A, Woodward ER, Lord S, Hawkes L, Evans DG, Franklin J, Hanson H, Blagden SP. results.title: Inhibiting mitochondrial respiration prevents cancer in a mouse model of Li-Fraumeni syndrome.
results.text_hl: In a pilot study, @<m>DISEASE_Li_Fraumeni_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016864 @@@LFS@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ exhibited decreases in mitochondrial activity concomitant with activation of antiproliferation signaling, thus reproducing the effects of disrupting mitochondrial function observed in @<m>DISEASE_Li_Fraumeni_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016864 @@@LFS@@@ @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@.

citations.NLM: Wang PY, Li J, Walcott FL, Kang JG, Starost MF, Talagala SL, Zhuang J, Park JH, Huffstutler RD, Bryla CM, Mai PL, Pollak M, Annunziata CM, Savage SA, Fojo AT, Hwang PM. Inhibiting mitochondrial respiration prevents cancer in a mouse model of Li-Fraumeni syndrome. J Clin Invest. 2017 Jan 3;127(1):132-136. PMID: 27869650
citations.BibTeX: @article{27869650, title={Inhibiting mitochondrial respiration prevents cancer in a mouse model of Li-Fraumeni syndrome.}, author={Wang PY and Li J and Walcott FL and Kang JG and Starost MF and Talagala SL and Zhuang J and Park JH and Huffstutler RD and Bryla CM and Mai PL and Pollak M and Annunziata CM and Savage SA and Fojo AT and Hwang PM}, journal={J Clin Invest}, volume={127}, number={1}, pages={132-136}}

results.title: Metformin improves the glucose and lipid metabolism via influencing the level of serum total bile acids in rats with streptozotocin-induced type 2 diabetes mellitus.
results.text_hl: After administration of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, the levels of FBG, @CHEMICAL_Triglycerides @CHEMICAL_MESH:D014280 @@@TG@@@, TC, LDLC and TBA in @DISEASE_Myotonic_Dystrophy @DISEASE_MESH:D009223 @@@DM@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Li_Fraumeni_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016864 @@@LI@@@ group were higher than NC group.

citations.NLM: Meng XM, Ma XX, Tian YL, Jiang Q, Wang LL, Shi R, Ding L, Pang SG. Metformin improves the glucose and lipid metabolism via influencing the level of serum total bile acids in rats with streptozotocin-induced type 2 diabetes mellitus. Eur Rev Med Pharmacol Sci. 2017 May;21(9):2232-2237. PMID: 28537659
citations.BibTeX: @article{28537659, title={Metformin improves the glucose and lipid metabolism via influencing the level of serum total bile acids in rats with streptozotocin-induced type 2 diabetes mellitus.}, author={Meng XM and Ma XX and Tian YL and Jiang Q and Wang LL and Shi R and Ding L and Pang SG}, journal={Eur Rev Med Pharmacol Sci}, volume={21}, number={9}, pages={2232-2237}}

results.title: Precancer Atlas to Drive Precision Prevention Trials.
results.text_hl: Emerging genetic and pharmacologic (@<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@) disruption of mitochondrial (mt) respiration increased autophagy to prevent @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@cancer@@@ in a @<m>DISEASE_Li_Fraumeni_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016864 @@@Li-Fraumeni@@@ @SPECIES_10090 @@@mouse@@@ model (biology reproduced in clinical pilot) and revealed profound influences of subtle changes in mt DNA background variation on @DISEASE_Obesity @DISEASE_MESH:D009765 @@@obesity@@@, aging, and @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@cancer@@@ risk.

citations.NLM: Spira A, Yurgelun MB, Alexandrov L, Rao A, Bejar R, Polyak K, Giannakis M, Shilatifard A, Finn OJ, Dhodapkar M, Kay NE, Braggio E, Vilar E, Mazzilli SA, Rebbeck TR, Garber JE, Velculescu VE, Disis ML, Wallace DC, Lippman SM. Precancer Atlas to Drive Precision Prevention Trials. Cancer Res. 2017 Apr 1;77(7):1510-1541. PMID: 28373404
